definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
to leave office for a high and distant place (idiom); to retire and place oneself above the fray

sentences.english: National sovereignty was previously a standard held aloft mainly by British eurosceptics.
sentences.chinese: 以前，國家主權主要是英國“疑歐派”高舉的旗幟。

sentences.english: They rejoice in your name all day long; they exult in your righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 他們因你的名終日歡樂，因你的公義得以高舉。

sentences.english: Men were departing from the word of God, and exalting theories of their own invention.
sentences.chinese: 人們正在偏離上帝的真道，而高舉自己發明的理論。

sentences.english: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
sentences.chinese: 他們因你的名終日歡樂，因你的公義得以高舉。

sentences.english: You have exalted the right hand of his foes, have gladdened all his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 你高舉了他仇人的右手，使他的敵人都滿心歡愉。

sentences.english: The picture shows team appealing for resistance against Japan on the streets of Mandalay.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲工作隊高舉隊旗在曼德勒市街頭宣傳抗日。

sentences.english: Pezzo crosses the line with arms up celebrating victory.
sentences.chinese: 佩佐衝線，雙臂高舉慶祝勝利。

sentences.english: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
sentences.chinese: 有一宗人，眼目何其高傲，眼皮也是高舉。
高舉閃着凱旋的寶劍刀鋒。
喜樂是愛被高舉時的情緒。

sentences.english: The upraised hammer dropped from his hands.
sentences.chinese: 高舉的錘從他的手中落下來。

sentences.english: Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride?
sentences.chinese: 揚起聲來，高舉眼目攻擊誰呢？

sentences.english: It upsets the trade balance, they are holding the stick but no carrots.
sentences.chinese: 這打破了貿易平衡，他們高舉着棒子卻沒有獎勵品。

sentences.english: All rose and meeklyraised their hands.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都站起來，恭順的高舉雙手。

sentences.english: Finally, all civil and military officials in the court held high wine glasses to congratulate on Emperor Xuanzong birthday.
sentences.chinese: 最後朝中文武百官高舉酒杯齊聲爲玄宗祝壽。

sentences.english: Your festal banner wave on high, The cross of Christ your King.
sentences.chinese: 基督十架爲你聖旗，高舉隨風飄揚。

definition: Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
to hold firmly, not let go
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
